extends java.lang.Object

      STVElection​(int numSeats, java.lang.String ballotFileLocation, boolean shuffle)
      The default Constructor for the STV Election class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void displayStats()
      Prints out election statistics to the terminal for viewing purposes.
      void generateBallots()
      Creates a new ballotGenerator and creates a new ArrayList of ballots using the createBallots function.
      java.util.ArrayList<Ballot> getBallots()
      Retrieves the ArrayList of Ballots and returns it.
      int getDroop()
      Retrieves the number calculated to be droop This is the number of votes that candidates want to reach
      java.util.HashMap<Candidate,java.util.ArrayList<Ballot>> getElected()
      Retrieves the HashMap of elected candidates and their respective Ballot ArrayLists.
      java.util.ArrayList<Candidate> getLosers()
      Retrieves the ArrayList of candidates who did not meet droop
      java.util.HashMap<Candidate,java.util.ArrayList<Ballot>> getNonElected()
      Retrieves the HashMap of non elected candidates and their respective Ballot ArrayLists.
      int getNumCandidates()
      Retrieves the number of candidates and returns it.
      int getNumSeats()
      Retrieves the number of seats to fill and returns it.
      boolean isShuffled()
      Checks whether the shuffle option has been chosen by the user, which indicates that the order of ballots will be shuffled before counting
      void runElection()
      Runs an election by generating ballots and then determining the elected and non elected candidates and places them in their different HashMaps.

    • Constructor Detail

      • STVElection

        public STVElection​(int numSeats,
                   java.lang.String ballotFileLocation,
                   boolean shuffle)
        The default Constructor for the STV Election class. It takes in the number of seats, the location of the ballot file, and the option to shuffle.
        Parameters:
        numSeats - The number of seats to fill during the election.
        ballotFileLocation - The ballot file location, held as a String.
        shuffle - A boolean option, where true indicates the ballots will shuffled before counted

    • Method Detail

      • getDroop

        public int getDroop()
        Retrieves the number calculated to be droop This is the number of votes that candidates want to reach
        Returns:
        The int droop

      • isShuffled

        public boolean isShuffled()
        Checks whether the shuffle option has been chosen by the user, which indicates that the order of ballots will be shuffled before counting
        Returns:
        The boolean value indicating if the ballots will be/have been shuffled

      • getElected

        public java.util.HashMap<Candidate,java.util.ArrayList<Ballot>> getElected()
        Retrieves the HashMap of elected candidates and their respective Ballot ArrayLists.
        Returns:

      • getLosers

        public java.util.ArrayList<Candidate> getLosers()
        Retrieves the ArrayList of candidates who did not meet droop
        Returns:
        The ArrayList of (potentially) losing candidates

        public java.util.ArrayList<Ballot> getBallots()
        Retrieves the ArrayList of Ballots and returns it.
        Returns:

        Retrieves the number of candidates and returns it.

      • runElection

        public void runElection()
        Runs an election by generating ballots and then determining the elected and non elected candidates and places them in their different HashMaps.

      • displayStats

        public void displayStats()
        Prints out election statistics to the terminal for viewing purposes.

      • generateBallots

        public void generateBallots()
        Creates a new ballotGenerator and creates a new ArrayList of ballots using the createBallots function. Sets the votes ArrayList equal to the newly generated ballot list.
